bug.short_desc: Unable to create class 'CompatibilityView' - Mylyn TaskListView

long_desc.thetext:
I got the following error in the Juno RC2 RCP package. The error seems to be from the TaskListView and shows up as soon as the workbench tries to show this view in a perspective.
!SESSION 2012-06-01 13:49:31.245 ----------------------------------------------- eclipse.buildId=I20120524-2100 java.version=1.6.0_24 java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc. BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86_64, WS=gtk, NL=en_GB Framework arguments: -product org.eclipse.epp.package.rcp.product Command-line arguments: -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86_64 -product org.eclipse.epp.package.rcp.product -consoleLog
!ENTRY org.eclipse.e4.ui.workbench 4 0 2012-06-01 13:50:13.516 !MESSAGE Unable to create class 'org.eclipse.ui.internal.e4.compatibility.CompatibilityView' from bundle '384' !STACK 0 Maybe bug 381359 describes the same issue.
I assume it's caused by the new Lucene dependency introduced by Recommenders. David forced me to use the orbit equivalents of our Lucene bundle which are lucene.misc, lucene.queries, lucene.core in version 3.5 See bug 380499 for more details.
*** Bug 381447 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 381476 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Thanks for investigating the problem, Marcel. I have fixed the version constraints in the task list index bundle and opened bug 381505 to add a safe guard. I'll update the Juno contribution shortly.
I tested it in the RCP/RAP package in an update from RC2 to RC3 and can confirm that the view is now working again. Thanks!
*** Bug 387845 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Hi, I think I experience the same bug, but I don't understand how to fix it. Do I have to upgrade from RC2 to RC3 and how do I do that?
I would recommend updating to the latest version of Mylyn: http://eclipse.org/mylyn/.
